case_vignette: A 56-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of a 3-day history of malaise, dysuria, blurred vision, and a painful, itchy rash. The rash began on her chest and face and spread to her limbs, palms, and soles. One week ago, she was diagnosed with trigeminal neuralgia and started on a new medicine. She appears ill. Her temperature is 38°C (100.4°F) and pulse is 110/min. Physical examination shows conjunctival injection and ulceration on the tongue and palate. There is no lymphadenopathy. Examination of the skin shows confluent annular, erythematous macules, bullae, and desquamation of the palms and soles. The epidermis separates when the skin is lightly stroked.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been feeling unwell with pain and itching, experiencing problems with urination, blurred vision, and a painful, itchy rash that has spread from my chest and face to my limbs, palms, and soles.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for 3 days.
Have you had any recent new sexual contacts or a new partner?
No, I have not had any recent new sexual contacts or a new partner.
Do you have a fever or any flu-like symptoms?
Yes, I have a fever with a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F).
Have you noticed any new medication or dietary changes recently before the symptoms started?
Yes, I started on a new medicine for trigeminal neuralgia about a week ago.
What medication did you start taking for your trigeminal neuralgia?
I'm sorry, I don't know the specific name of the medication I started taking for my trigeminal neuralgia.
Have you had any similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have not had any similar symptoms in the past.
Final Diagnosis: Stevens-Johnson syndrome
